intro: Sisymbrium bonariense, commonly known as Argentine peppergrass, is an annual herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are elongated and pinnately lobed, and it produces small, round seeds that are dispersed by wind. Sisymbrium bonariense is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
